back: A matrix is in RRE form (reduced row-echelon form) if it meets all of these requirements: (1) Any rows of all zeros appear below all nonzero rows; (2) The leading nonzero of any row is a one; (3) Every leading 1 that is lower than another leading 1 is also to the right of it; (3) Every leading 1 is the only nonzero in its column.
author: Hehn

back: The columns of a matrix in RRE form that have leading ones.

back: The columns of a matrix in RRE form that do not have leading ones.
author: Hehn

author: Hehn
